question: \text{Let } g(x) = 3x^2 - 12x + 3. \text{ What is the minimum value of } g(x) + 3 \text{?}
\text{The expression } x^2 - x - 56 \text{ is equivalent to which of the following?}

\text{A carpenter hammers 10 nails per minute and installs 7 screws per minute.} \\ \text{If the carpenter hammers nails for } x \text{ minutes and installs screws for } y \text{ minutes} \\ \text{for a total of 200 nails and screws, which equation represents this scenario?}
\text{What is the measure of } \angle F \text{ in the triangle } \triangle DEF, \text{ where } \angle D = 73^\circ \text{ and } \angle E = 35^\circ?

\text{The total amount of plastic remaining to be recycled in a facility over} \\ \text{x shifts is represented by the graph above. Which of the} \\ \text{following represents the y\text{-intercept of the graph?}}

options.A: \text{The total amount of plastic remaining at any given time}
options.B: \text{The number of shifts it will take to finish recycling the plastic}
options.C: \text{The amount of plastic that is recycled per shift}
options.D: \text{The initial amount of plastic to be recycled}

question: \text{The table below shows the condition and subject type for} \\ \text{200 textbooks at a bookstore. What is the probability that a} \\ \text{textbook chosen at random will be a new textbook?} \\ \text{(Express your} \\ \text{answer as a decimal or fraction, not as a percent.)}

\text{A random sample of 5,000 students out of 60,000 undergraduate students at} \\ \text{a university were surveyed about a potential change to the registration system.} \\ \text{According to the survey results, 75\% of the respondents did not support} \\ \text{the existing registration system, with a 4\% margin of error. Which} \\ \text{of the following represents a reasonable total number of students who} \\ \text{did not support the existing registration system?}
\text{What is the negative solution to the equation } \\ \dfrac{32}{a} = a - 4?

\text{After a hot air balloon is launched from a plateau 1,000 meters above} \\ \text{sea level, it rises at a constant rate of 750 meters per minute.} \\ \text{Which of the following best describes the function used to model the} \\ \text{balloon's distance above sea level over time?}
\text{What is the x-intercept of } f(x) = 22^x - 1\   \text{when it is graphed in the xy-plane, where y = f(x)? }

passage: \text{In parallelogram } ABCD, AB \text{ is one-third the length of } AD. \text{ The perimeter of the parallelogram is 64.}
question: \text{In parallelogram ABCD shown above, the length of AB is one-third} \\ \text{the length of AD. The perimeter of the parallelogram is 64. What} \\ \text{is the length of AB?}
\text{A triangle with an area of 18 square units has a base of} \\ \text{(m + 5) units and a height of m units. What is the value} \\ \text{of m?}

passage: \text{Yeast colony growth is shown in a table: } t=0:5, t=1:20, t=2:80, t=3:320.
question: \text{The table above shows the exponential growth of a type of yeast over} \\ \text{time } s, \text{ in seconds. There are } c \text{ total yeast colonies on} \\ \text{the count plate. What is the equation that represents this relationship,} \\ \text{assuming that no yeast was added or removed after counting began?}
\text{The equations } 12x = y \text{ and } 24x + 7 = 2y \text{ intersect at} \\ \text{how many points when graphed in the } xy\text{-plane?}

\text{Several tiles labeled with either an A or a B are placed} \\ \text{in a bag, and tiles are worth a different point} \\ \text{value depending on the label. The equation 15a + 106 =} \\ \text{100 represents the situation when a of the A tiles and} \\ \text{b of the B tiles are drawn from the bag for} \\ \text{a total of 100 points. How many points would be} \\ \text{earned by drawing one A tile and one B tile from the bag?}

\text{The amount of money remaining in a scholarship fund is reduced} \\ \text{by one-fourth every year. The amount of money in the fund} \\ \text{is represented by } d \text{ and the number of years by } y. \\ \text{If the fund starts with \$10,000, which equation below represents this situation} \\ \text{after } y \text{ years?}
\text{What is the diameter, in millimeters (mm), of a cylinder} \\ \text{with a volume of 144 mm}^3 \text{ and a height of 4 mm?}
\text{4x + 2y = 4} \\ \text{19x + 10y = 14} \\ \text{When graphed in the } xy\text{-plane, the linear equations shown above intersect at} \\ \text{(a, b). What is the value of } a?
\text{The longest side of right triangle ABC is opposite angle B.} \\ \text{If } \sin(A) = \text{, what is the value of } \sin(C)?
\text{Function } g \text{ reaches its maximum value when } x = a. \\ \text{If } g(x) = -6x^2 - 30x - 24, \text{ what is the value of } a?

\text{f(x) = -x - 3. The linear function } f(x), \text{ given above,} \\ \text{is perpendicular to } g(x) \text{ when graphed in the } xy\text{-plane.} \\ \text{If } g(0) = 0, \text{ what is the value of } g(2)?
\text{y = } 5k x^{2} + 2x + 3 \\ \text{7 = } -x + 10 \\ \text{The system of equations above has exactly one solution.} \\ \text{If } k \text{ is a constant, what is the value of } k?
